properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Southwesterly winds will reach up to 90 km/h and will ease during the day. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-12T03:59:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-11T16:30:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0380613080.2020
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow continues in the Cypress Hills. While much of southwestern Saskatchewan will see light snow gradually taper off today, the Cypress Hills will continue to see moderate to heavy snow sustained by a northwest wind. A further 5 to 15 cm of snow is likely over the Cypress Hills today. Travellers should be prepared for poor road conditions in these regions. The snow will finally come to an end this evening as the winds diminish. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-12T02:33:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-11T10:34:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4181858071.2020

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. Locations: Happy Valley-Goose Bay and Eagle River. Time span: continuing this evening. Remarks: Freezing rain will change to showers late this evening as temperatures rise above zero. Motorists travelling the Trans-Labrador Highway can expect icy road conditions this evening. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-11-12T04:59:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-11T21:22:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3542480169.2020
Area: Upper Lake Melville, Eagle River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm is expected. A cold front tracking southward across Baffin Island will bring heavy snowfall to the Pangnirtung area tonight. Snowfall will intensify as the front moves through the region before gradually tapering off to a few flurries Thursday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-12T12:35:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-11T20:36:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2895214474.2020
Area: Pangnirtung
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-11-12T18:28:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-12T02:28:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2002040866.2020
Area: Northern Peninsula East
properties.Author: Environment Canada
